# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line\n" # add the last line
    return result
end
```
This function splits a string into words and iterates over them. It checks if adding the next word to the current line would exceed the `text_width`. If it does, it adds the current line to the final result and starts a new one. At the end of all iterations, it adds the last line to the result.

An example usage:
```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit", 15))
```
This will print:
```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit
```
